I know why they're being suppressed. I know who's suppressing them,” Dershowitz said during an appearance on “The Sean Spicer Show.” “But...

author: Joseph Choi
description: The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) announced Thursday it was rescinding a nearly 30-year interpretation of legislation that allowed immigrants without legal status to access certain federal public benefits. HHS said it was officially rescinding a 1998 interpretation of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act (PRWORA), which allowed immigrants without legal...
title: RFK Jr. bans Head Start, health clinic access for people in US illegally

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Sen. John Kennedy (R-La.) on Thursday slammed former FBI Director James Comey and former CIA Director John Brennan for being disliked among Washington’s political elite. “I know people who have worked with them closely, and maybe talk to people closely, those people will tell you that they're about as popular as male pattern baldness,” Kennedy...
title: Senate Republican says Comey and Brennan 'are as popular as male pattern baldness'

author: Alex Gangitano
description: White House budget chief Russ Vought on Thursday accused Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell of mismanaging the central bank’s budget during renovations, adding to President Trump’s criticism of Powell. Vought, in a letter to Powell, said Trump is “extremely troubled” that he has “plowed ahead with an ostentatious overhaul” of the Fed’s headquarters in Washington,...
title: White House accuses Powell of mismanaging the Fed, citing renovation

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The Obamas are teaming up with Larry David to produce a six-episode sketch comedy series on HBO to mark the country’s 250th anniversary, parent company Warner Bros. Discovery announced Thursday. The untitled limited series will focus on American history and will be executive produced by David, Jeff Schaffer and Higher Ground, the media company founded...
title: Obamas to produce Larry David US history sketch comedy series for HBO

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: The number of local journalists per capita in the United States has declined by about 75% on average since 2002, according to a new report by the nonprofit Rebuild Local News and Muck Rack, an aggregator of journalism bylines. That includes more than 1,000 counties — about one in three — that do not have...
title: 1,000 US counties without full-time local journalist: Report

author: Jonathan Easley
description: Plus: Political battle shaping up between Texas, Florida {beacon} WASHINGTON is barreling toward a confrontation with Moscow, as tension grows between President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin.   Putin has ramped up strikes on Ukraine in the days since Trump lashed out at the Russian leader for continuing to fight.   Russia pounded residential...
title: Washington, Moscow speed toward confrontation

author: Rep. Gabe Evans (R-Colo.), opinion contributor
description: Republicans are proposing a $750 million investment in the Federal Law Enforcement Training Center to ensure law enforcement officers are properly trained and prepared to protect the American people.
title: ‘Big Beautiful Bill’ funding will train all levels of law enforcement amid grave threats

author: Rachel Frazin
description: Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Administrator Lee Zeldin said Thursday that Americans have “legitimate questions” about airplane contrails as his agency launches webpages aimed at combatting misinformation on the topic. Contrails, the vapor trails that follow high-flying airplanes, are the subject of the “chemtrails” conspiracy theory which baselessly alleges that the trails are actually chemicals that are used...
title: Zeldin cites 'legitimate questions' about contrails as EPA launches webpage to combat conspiracy

description: President Trump met with Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) on Wednesday evening to talk about Senate races, including Sen. John Cornyn’s (R-Texas) fraught primary against Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton (R), according to a source familiar with the matter.  Senate Leadership Fund officials were also present at the meeting. The source said the meeting...
title: Trump met with Thune to discuss Senate races, including Texas

author: Steven Lubet, opinion contributor
description: It is beyond ironic that Cruz has sponsored legislation to exclude disfavored children from the Constitution, given that he is not a 14th Amendment citizen himself.
title: Ted Cruz and birthright citizenship: Be careful what you wish for

author: Filip Timotija
description: The American public is evenly divided over the implications of artificial intelligence (AI). Still, the majority thinks the new technology will reduce the need for people to do creative or important tasks, according to a new survey that was released on Thursday.  The new Gallup poll found that 49 percent of the U.S. adults said...
title: US divided over AI implications: Gallup

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: A Michigan judge rejected a challenge to the state’s longtime ban on taxpayer-funded abortions for low-income residents.   The lawsuit argued that the ban had no standing after Michiganders voted in 2022 to pass a constitutional amendment ensuring the right to an abortion.   Judge Brock A. Swartzle ruled that the group that filed the...
title: Challenge to Michigan ban on taxpayer-funded abortions rejected

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The Education Department announced on Thursday a civil rights investigation against George Mason University over allegations of discrimination regarding its diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) policies.  The federal agency said multiple professors at the university alleged leadership is giving preferential treatment to underrepresented minority groups for hiring and promotion considerations among faculty.   “Despite the...
title: Education Department announces investigation against George Mason over DEI

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Steve Bannon argued a special counsel should be appointed to review files related to Jeffrey Epstein amid outrage from the right over a government memo saying the disgraced financier had no "client list" and was not murdered in prison while awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges. “They have to go to the court and demand...
title: Bannon calls for special prosecutor on Epstein files

author: Harlan Ullman, opinion contributor
description: The fault lies with us, the American public and two political parties that are deeply flawed.
title: America is at war with itself

title: Whose power is the war power?

author: Mark Goldfeder, Anat Beck and Erielle Davidson, opinion contributors
description: Federal anti-boycott laws make it illegal for U.S. companies to comply with foreign government boycott requests targeting Israel. That means American firms that change their behavior in response to Ireland’s new law.

title: 'Intentional scare tactic,' say community leaders after feds swarm Puerto Rican museum in Chicago

description: House Democrats are calling for an immediate hearing on disaster preparations after catastrophic flooding in Texas, citing concerns about FEMA's readiness and the Trump administration's weakening of the Federal government's capacity to respond to disasters.

author: Aris Folley
description: The Senate Appropriations Committee on Thursday approved an amendment to the annual Justice Department funding bill aimed at blocking the Trump administration from keeping the FBI's headquarters in Washington, D.C. The committee voted 15-14 to adopt language that seeks to block funding from being used to relocate the headquarters from its current J. Edgar Hoover...
title: Senate committee votes to block Trump FBI headquarters move

description: Democrats Reps. Greg Stanton (Ariz.) and Gabe Amo (R.I.) on Thursday slammed Department of Homeland Security (DHS) administrator Kristi Noem over the administration's response to fatal flooding in Texas amid its efforts to cut disaster response, climate and weather agencies. "They need to justify it, and I guarantee you here, they will not be able...

description: Shamefully, almost 100 non-judicial nominees that have already been approved by Senate committees still await a vote by the full Senate.

description: With a few exceptions, there has been no hunting on Sundays in Pennsylvania. That's now set to change.

description: President Trump and Congress are threatening harsh sanctions against Moscow for its three-year war in Ukraine.

title: Tillis suggests he wouldn't vote in favor of Hegseth confirmation now

description: The Ukrainian ambassador to the U.S. will depart as President Volodymyr Zelensky looks to reshape relationships in Washington amid the war with Russia. Oksana Markarova is out as the leading U.S. diplomat, according to Ukraine’s foreign minister, Andrii Sybiha. “She is extremely effective and charismatic, but every diplomat has a rotation cycle," Sybiha said during...
title: Ukraine's ambassador to US departing as Zelensky shakes up diplomats
